headline: Spinach, Tomato, and Feta Egg White Omelette
description: Egg white omelette stuffed with spinach, tomato, and feta cheese is an easy and filling way to start the day.
name: Spinach, Tomato, and Feta Egg White Omelette
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
0.25 cup chopped fresh spinach, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray.

Whisk egg whites with salt and pepper in a bowl. Pour egg mixture into the heated skillet and swirl until eggs cover entire bottom of skillet; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Arrange spinach, tomatoes, and feta cheese in the middle of the eggs. Cook until edges of eggs begin to curl up, 2 to 3 more minutes. Loosen omelet from the skillet using a spatula and fold in half; continue cooking until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: I like to use 1 whole egg, beaten, and 3 egg whites. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form n gently fold together. Halve the tomatoes and saute with a small amt. olive oil and as much garlic as you like; just to soften. Add spinach just long enough to soften, not really wilt. Stir in cheese. (I prefer goat cheese, but feta never disappoints.) Make your omelet w most of the filling inside and a little (or just more..) on top. Brunch or dinner for 2!
I am just finishing up my breakfast! a great omelet! I omitted the tomatoes and added only a pinch of salt as the feta cheese is salty enough. besides those tweaks for our family, it was a winner!
It is a awesome recipe. Only thing i did different is i added onions
I thought I would like it with a feta but I did not. The part of the omelet that didn't have feta was very good but the rest of it yuck
I loved this omelette! It's a quick healthy meal for any time of day.

A nice easy light breakfast. I added a bit of red bell pepper as i wanted to use it up.
March 2/2019
Easy and quick to make plus healthy and delicious!
My family loved this one. So easy to make and tasty. I was a breakfast hero with minimal effort.

This is so good! I only added some cayenne because I like some heat and turmeric. This tricks the eye with adding some yolk color and is super good for you so I add it a lot when I cook. The 1st time I made it I put way too much tomato and spinach in so it didn’t look pretty but tasted great still! The second time I backed down a bit and it looks more omelette like.
Pretty good! Used the whole egg, not just whites.
Easy and delicious! I will make it again and again!
Yes. I will make it again. Delicious!
Easy to make, low calories or points for those on WW and delicious to boot!
My daughter and I loved it, didn't change anything. Except I didn't have any fresh spinach so I left it out. It was still amazing and filling.
Nothing short of AMAZING! Totally Keto friendly!! Will make over and over again.
Followed the recipe, and it was delicious. Will definitely make this again
Sautéed onion & a little garlic
This is delicious and I will definitely make it again. I will try it again with kale and mozzarella cheese and add some mushrooms too.
GREAT BREAKFAST - but why just egg whites? What is wrong with the yolks? My chickens lay the best eggs...used the entire egg and it was awesome.
delish!!! And only 121 calories, amazing.
So simple, so delicious!!! Will be making again tomorrow!
I used this recipe as a base to copy an omelet I liked from diner. I used the whole egg, coconut oil in the pan, salt and pepper, but skipped the tomato because I didn't have any. It was delicious!
It was an awesome omelette! I used whole eggs. I also cooked the tomatoes and spinach and added a red pepper to the mix. Definitely will make it again! My husband loved it too!
So simple and yummy!!! Healthy fast breakfast
This was really good! I cooked the spinach and tomatoes with some cooking spray on a frying pan for a minute and then added it to the egg omelet. The feta cheese adds a lot of delicious flavor!
Really nice easy recipe. Make sure you use a non-stick pan and also add in a little basil into the mix kicks up a flavor.
We enjoyed this--of course a couple of revisions. Used six egg whites in a large pan; chopped green onion in egg; a little Italian Seasoning over all. Delicious and quick!
amazing!! I sautéed my veggies in alittle oil and vinegar before cooking egg whites and I topped it with avocado!! yum....

I substituted pretty much everything in here; used whole eggs, parmesan, romaine, and cherry tomatoes, because we had plenty of ingredients but nothing prepared for dinner. Feta probably works better than parm, I believe. The instructions on when to fold the omelette was really valuable. I'm trying to go vegetarian, and I will turn to this recipe time and again for omelettes!

My new favorite fast food breakfast! I used 2 whole eggs (I can't get into the anemic look of egg whites alone) I sautéed the tomatoes to make their flavor pop and just tossed in the spinach for a second to get rid of their rawness and I did use feta. My husband who generally won't touch spinach loves this dish.

Used egg beaters just to try it out lol I love egg whites so next time I'll use that but I used a little oil to sautée the vegetables. I used bacon bits, mushrooms, green bell peppers, onions and jalapeños. :)
Excellent! Very easy to make and tasty. A good basic omelette, too, for other fillings. I advise watching the salt . It doesn't need as much as a full-egg version.
My husband was sure he was going to hate it, but he loved it and so did I.

I used 2 eggs instead of whites, roma tomatoes instead of cherry, and queso fresco instead of feta. i also topped it with salsa verde because again, Latino. I'm very happy with the end result, was gonna skip the tomato all together but I'm glad I didn't, it adds to the bright and fresh of the omelet all together.
Excellent.
I made this today for breakfast. It was delicious! I added som arugula with the spinach and had it with turkey bacon. This will be one of my breakfast staples from now on!
Simple and quite tasty!
Excellent flavor!! I used Athenos tomato & basil feta cheese for a bit more flavor.

This recipe is sooooo easy AND flavorful. I decide to sauté the fresh spinach and cherry tomatoes before cooking the egg whites. However, next time, my husband wants me to try it without the sauté step. My husband does not eat many veggies but he likes this recipe!!! I made it twice this week already! It's good with and without the feta cheese. By the way, I use garlic salt and freshly ground black pepper when I whisk the egg whites. I wonder if we can call this a Greek egg white omelette? "I'm strong to the finish, 'cause I eats me Spinach, I'm Popeye the sailor man! (toot, toot)"

I normally wouldn't consider taking the yolks out of an omelette, but after making eggnog I had lots of whites to use. This turned out to be very good, with the flavorful fillings. I used butter to coat the pan instead of cooking spray, and the omelette had a nice crisp outer edge.
delicious!!

Wow - feta cheese and scrambled eggs together! This made for a light yet filling breakfast with a tasty combination of flavors. I did sautee the spinach along with a little onion and garlic then added the rest of the ingredients. I opted to use egg beaters which worked out nice and fat free feta cheese. Perfect with a side of whole grain toast and fresh fruit!

item.name: Spinach, Tomato, and Feta Egg White Omelette
